Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2010 12:53PM sumby wrote: Thanks Lauren and melulv.  I left you private messages in your inbox. Nene, thanks so much for sharing your story with me. I pray the Lord will bless your family and i wish you the best with the adoption process. It is well. Balsie - Thanks for the encouraging words...I am holding on to what you said and i believe i have a good future...that is really nice to know Aliting - Pls keep us posted on the details of your diagnosis. I'm so sorry you are facing this at this young age....It is well
Posts.Title: Is anybody else as young as i am? sumby nmiller

Posts.Content: sumby wrote: Hello, I'm just curious: Is there anybody less than 30years old on this forum who has been diagnosed with breast cancer? I just turned 27 this month and the first thing people say to me on hearing the news is that it's uncommon for people of my age. I just want to know if there's anybody else as young as i am. I really need to know.... Thanks Dx 1/16/2010, IDC, Left, 3cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 10/11 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Is anybody else as young as i am? sumby nmiller

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2010 07:58AM sumby wrote: Thanks Nene, Fumi and Lisamg. It's a relief to know i'm not the only one who has been diagnosed below 30 with BC. What scares me and made me really particular about finding people in my age bracket are all the scary side effects of chemo such as fertility and all...i went to the young survivors website yesterday and i was amazed at the survivor stories of so many people less than 30. Fumi, are you Nigerian?
Posts.Title: Is anybody else as young as i am? sumby nmiller

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2010 01:31PM sumby wrote: Thanks Jule, Linda and southport....i will check those websites out. I just need to know that there are other young people like me out there going through this challenge:people that are just starting out there lives... Amy, thanks for sharing the story of your peer mentor..that's encouraging. I pray i will be an inspiration to someone in not so distant future...it's just overwhelming taking the whole thing in at this point and the journey ahead seems so long and scary but i pray for the strength to be able to fight this. Thanks guys once again
Posts.Title: Is anybody else as young as i am? sumby nmiller

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2010 06:34AM sumby wrote: Hi, I had my left MX on 30/03/2010 and i will be starting chemo today! (in abt 45 mins actually.) Pls add me to the thread. I'm having Epirubicin and cyclophosphamide EC X 4 and the Taxotere for another 4 cycles. Followed by radiation for 3 weeks and then tamoxifen for five years.
Posts.Title: April 2010 starting chemo caltex_catlady kad22

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2010 03:34PM sumby wrote: Hi Dutchgirl: Thanks for the info...lol at the "great, maybe the vaccuuming will get done"....i took a couple of steroids with my first regimen(EC) and i had terrible heartburn/indigestion, not that much energy though : ) No, i won't be taking either of those shots...what was that for? But what major SEs did you experience with the T?
Posts.Title: April 2010 starting chemo caltex_catlady kad22

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2010 02:10PM sumby wrote: Hi ladies, it's been a while I came on this forum... Pls has anybody had Taxotere and what was the reaction to it? My first regimen was EC * 4 and I finished the last one two weeks ago with minimal side effects. I'm starting taxotere next week and I'm completely freaked out cos of the scary side effects I've been reading so would like personal experiences. Also, been using the scalp cooling which has been really great for my hair but I'm just completely tired of freezing my head for 3hours every 3weeks...confused whether I should just stop and let the hair fall up and grow up back : (
Posts.Title: April 2010 starting chemo caltex_catlady kad22

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2010 04:41PM sumby wrote: Thanks so much Dutchgirl...you won't believe how much your reply means to me. Guess I'm just so tired of the whole chemo process, I'm having 8 cycles and I'm just half way through and I'm really not in the mood to deal with any new side effects as the first regimen was pretty easy and yeah! sometimes I feel I'm not having enough SEs to justify the effectiveness of the drugs but I believe and have faith that it is doing what it's supposed to do. My breast care nurse called today and said I would need to take steroids on the day before the treatment, the day of the treatment and the day after....did u also have to do that? Thanks again...
Posts.Title: April 2010 starting chemo caltex_catlady kad22

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2010 03:55PM sumby wrote: Toughmom38: The truth is the scalp cooling actually works. See a few strands of hair every now and then but it's not noticeable. The only snag is having to have the cap on for almost 4hours every time i go in for treatment and that makes my hospital visit considerable longer. Thanks for the advice, might just stick it out...i'm half way through already. Caltex_catlady: I wasn't told about the 12 and 6 hour thing just that I should take 4 tabs twice a day for 3 days but will do the 12 and 6 hour thing, now that i know....thanks. Always have issues with sleeping with steroids though :(
Posts.Title: April 2010 starting chemo caltex_catlady kad22

Posts.Content: May 4, 2010 09:30PM sumby wrote: Hi Ladies, it's so nice to catch up on what's been happening to every one. Glad to know most SEs are manageable....hugs to those who are finding it a bit more difficult. Today is day 6 of my first cycle(EC) and have had some ups and downs....days 1 and 2 were pretty much a blur as i spent the days in bed. But apart from that, the SEs haven't been so bad except for this nagging chest pain i've had for about three days now. Sometimes breathing becomes so hard and i feel like there's a huge stone blocking my air way. Don't know if anyone else has experienced anything close to that. It gets really painful sometimes and makes sleeping difficult but i'm seeing my onc 2mrw so will discuss it with him. Also i noticed that my tongue is dark around the ages and I haven't been able to eat much since my cycle started....everything tastes flat... Take care ladies and all the best ((((((((((hugs)))))))))))))
Posts.Title: April 2010 starting chemo caltex_catlady kad22

Posts.Content: May 5, 2010 11:07PM sumby wrote: Thanks Prickles: Saw my onc today and he gave me some tablets for stomach acid...feel much better today(i can actually even forget i'm on chemo!!!) Susiesue: I'm happy for you on the good news especially cos of your daughter. Take care
Posts.Title: April 2010 starting chemo caltex_catlady kad22
